title: Seriff font
content:
If anyone know this font name. Pls tell me

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090811084118im_/http:/typophile.com/files/90026_MCKINLEYS-REGATTA_5284.jpg)
author: artslons

comments.content:
There seems to be some distortion in your image. Is this printing on fabric?

The A is unusual for two reasons: it has the half top serif, and it has almost no serif on the right leg. The closest A I have found to this is [Hiroshige](http://web.archive.org/web/20090811084118/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/hiroshige/), but it doesn’t seem to be a very close match for other letters like the R and T. Another calligraphic serif is [Tiepolo](http://web.archive.org/web/20090811084118/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-tiepolo/), but I can’t say that’s a clear match either.

Anyone else have any ideas?

- Mike Yanega

A couple of Arthur Baker’s other fonts are also similar, but not identical:  
 [Duckweed](http://web.archive.org/web/20090811084118/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/glyph/duckweed/) and [New Amigo](http://web.archive.org/web/20090811084118/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/arthurbaker/new-amigo/).

- Mike Yanega
